subject: Re: [junit] Test Dependencies
msgSnippet: Hi, I understand that using of mock object is ideal, but the problem is fetching the data from db is complicated and these tests I am talking about is to test
messageBody:
Hi,
I understand that using of mock object is ideal, but the problem is fetching
the data from db is complicated and these tests I am talking about is to
test the overall functionality of the system and also test the hibernate DAO
objects; that's why I prefer to use the database data to run the test.

Regards,
Arash

On 9/25/07, Ilya Zelker <i.zelker@...> wrote:
>
> One solution to consider is to use "mock" objects. You can try one of
> the mocking frameworks, i.e jmock.
>
> Ilya
>
> Arash Bijanzadeh wrote:
> >
> > I have a problem with the test dependencies. The application is a
> > database backed application and I want to test the db functionality.
> > For this purpose, first thing to be done is database populating which
> > itself is a test suite. Is there any way to specify the order or tests
> > in Junit? Or any other solution which suits this kind of scenarios?
> > Thanks in advance,
> > Arash
> >
> >
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>
>
>



--
You can not depend on your eyes when your imagination is out of focus.


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
